page.title: 01Tan Hill and Stonesdale Moor
page.content: Only one building occupies the block, which consists of hilly heather moorland in east.with rough grassland in Weststones Dale. Sheep are grzed on moorland, sheep and some cattle roam the grassland. Farmers use old railway freight vans as stores and briers, at least six are in west stone dale. The focal point of this and many adjacent blocks is the pub. The Tan Hill Inn the highest public house in britain. Well frequented by tourists in cars in high season. During the week you will find Pennine way walkers camping behind the Inn. The wide range of real ale and impromptu folk evenings are the attractions. In august 1985 the Inn was sold for Â£82500. At nearly 2000 feet snow is a regular hazard in winter and 2mtr posts are positioned along road to show direction of travel
